name: Presidents And Wifes Quiz | U.S. Government | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the first American first lady who could have voted for her husband for president?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Harding

	Florence Harding wife of Warren Harding. The 19th Amendment providing for women's suffrage became part of the Constitution in August 1920. Harding was elected the following November.

questions.text: Which president's tombstone carries the epitaph 'The greatest honor history can bestow is the title of peacemaker'?
What crop did George Washington use to make payments when he first leased Mount Vernon from his brother's widow in 1754?
questions.explanation:
tobacco.

	He paid 15,000 pounds a year.

questions.text: How many bathrooms are there in the White House?
questions.explanation:
35.

	I would hate to clean them. By the time you got done cleaning all of them, it would be time to start all over again.

questions.text: Which president while attending a circus announced he intended to run for a second term by throwing his hat into the center ring?
How many times did Henry Clay run unsuccessfully for the nation's highest office.
questions.explanation:
3.

	He was once quoted as saying, 'I'd rather be right than president'. He lost to Adams in 1824 and to Jackson in 1832 and to Polk in 1844.

questions.text: Who was president when the first cooking stove was installed in the White House?
questions.explanation:
Fillmore.

	In 1850. Before this the cooking was done in the kitchens fireplace. Try cooking a State dinner in a fire place!

questions.text: For modesty's sake, what did Martha Washington have sewn into the hem of her bathing suit?
questions.explanation:
lead weights.

	She did this to hold the skirt of the bathing dress down. One of her swimming outfits made of blue checked linen is on display at Mount Vernon.

questions.text: Which president named his dog Veto as a warning to Congress not to pass legislation he didn't like?
How many dollars did Abraham Lincoln have for a mileage allowance when he served in Congress?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Actually it was 8 bucks for 20 miles which came to about 40 cents a mile. He was allowed two round trips a year to Washington D.C. from his Illinois congressional district.
